etymology.description: 危(危) (wēi, "dangerous") is a variant form of 懸(懸) (xuán, "hang")
etymology.interpretation: The character 危(危) (wēi, "dangerous") is understood as a variant form of 懸(懸) (xuán, "hang"), emphasizing the meanings of danger and critical situations, derived from the notion of things hanging or suspended, which inherently carry risk.

examples.chinese: 山势险峻(山勢險峻)，情况危急(情況危急)。
examples.pinyin: Shān shì xiǎnjùn(Shān shì xiǎnjùn)，qíngkuàng wēijí(qíngkuàng wēijí)。
examples.english: The mountain terrain is steep, and the situation is critical.

examples.chinese: 那条山路又危又陡(那條山路又危又陡)。
examples.pinyin: Nà tiáo shānlù yòu wēi yòu dǒu(Nà tiáo shānlù yòu wēi yòu dǒu)。
examples.english: That mountain road is both dangerous and steep.

examples.chinese: 船行急流时(船行急流時)，处境非常危(處境非常危)。
examples.pinyin: Chuán xíng jíliú shí(Chuán xíng jíliú shí)，chǔjìng fēicháng wēi(Chǔjìng fēicháng wēi)。
examples.english: When the boat sails in rapid currents, its situation is extremely dangerous.
